New Records: Trent Boult became the first New Zealander — and sixth man overall — to collect 50 World Cup scalps.
Key Match Events: New Zealand defeated Sri Lanka by five wickets in Bengaluru.
Rachin Ravindra took his tally to 565 runs to move atop the scoring charts.
Trent Boult took 3 wickets for 37 runs, posing a particular threat.
Mitchell Santner celebrated the wicket of Sri Lanka's Angelo Mathews.
Sri Lanka were reduced to 113-8 in the 24th over.
Maheesh Theekshana formed the two longest partnerships of the innings for Sri Lanka.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand essentially booked a spot in the semifinals of the Cricket World Cup.
New Zealand will face India in the semifinals at Wankhede Stadium.
Kane Williamson was able to select from a full squad and deploy a well-balanced bowling unit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand finished the round robin with a 5-4 record and a net run rate healthy enough to all but lock down fourth on the ladder.
New Zealand needed only 23.2 overs to advance to another knockout round.
Sri Lanka's tailenders decided to dig in, with Maheesh Theekshana scoring 38 not out off 91 balls.
